history.text: what movie are we talking about
Well I clicked on Bruce Almighty but it gave me The Social Network anyway...
huh. what's up with the social network
Jesse Eisenberg plays Mark Zuckerberg, the developer of Facebook in this film and it's supposed to be a biographical film drama based on the initial development of Facebook.
far out. any interesting details
or just actor lists

According to the document, it's a "tale of sex, money, genius and betrayal" , plus Justin Timberlake and Andrew Garfield also play in the movie so it has a pretty good cast with a rating 9/10 on rotten tomatos
Zuckerberg and Facebook weren't involved in the production so I wonder how that went over.
David Fincher is the director, I'm not sure if you know him.
zuckerberg the genious betrayer?
i don't know him
Mark Zuckerberg, the man that developed Facebook.
The film has had a lot of critical responses that a positive, one critic said that the Social Network is the movie of the year.
the director "laced their scathing wit with an aching sadness, they define the dark irony of the past decade"
I'm sure they did.
Sounds very deep and interesting but I am not certain what this 'irony' is supposed to mean.
The movie was made in 2010 and it was adapted from a book called "the accidental billionaires" published in 2009
That our bast decade has brought us so much technology but little true happiness maybe?
*past decade

Perhaps being so connected with everyone, merely a text or Facebook post away, and yet it has created such great distance between people and taken a toll on the ability of people to socialize face to face.
Huh, yeah that seems reasonable. have you seen it?
The film is apparently as smart as its hero, but also 'cocksure', impatient, cold, exciting and perceptive.
No I haven't but I remember seeing a trailer about it a long time ago, It seemed pretty interesting.
i wonder what makes a film cocksure
Essentially multiple people developed facebook but Mark Zuckerberg stole the idea and betrayed his friends to make tons of money
I have no idea, weird choice of words for a film review
The movie sounds interesting, and it is supposed to be based on the real development of facebook, I think it would be an interesting film to see.
yeah, seems ok. probably won't watch it myself
Do you like biographical films? Or not really?
If you don't, then I wouldn't recommend it. It is supposed to be a biography mixed with drama and scheming, Think of 21 if you have ever seen that movie about gambling.
huh. I like biopics, but maybe not the facebook guy in a cocksure film.
Anything else you want to know?
I'm not so cocksure myself
hah! gosh, i cant imagine there is. does it tell you how long it is?
No but apparently Zuckerberg stole the idea of facebook at harvard and used it to post pictures of girls on his college campus to rate their attractiveness and say nasty things about them
classy guy
yeah, doesn't change my view of him much. who does Timberlake play?
Sean parker, a developer
does zuckerberg screw him over?
Yes, he steals his ideas and all of his money
hah! good on him i guess.
The facebook hit all of the ivy league schools then was made available to the public
yeah, i remember when that happened

uid1response.feedback: not so bad. it kinda felt like the other user was a little bit spitting out facts at the beginning but it amused me and made me giggle.
